title: Did Trump forget which state he was in? 'Is Trump OK?' Watch
content: Donald Trump on Saturday shouted out North Carolina from the campaign rally. But the problem was he was in Pennsylvania and his action did not go unnoticed and people thought he confused North Carolina and Pennsylvania and whether he was in sound mind and body. The Trump campaign, however, strongly defended the 'confusion' and said Trump was addressing a group of supporters from North Carolina whom he knew.
summary: Donald Trump on Saturday shouted out North Carolina from the campaign rally. But the problem was he was in Pennsylvania and his action did not go unnoticed and people thought he confused North Carolina and Pennsylvania and whether he was in sound mind and body. The Trump campaign, however, strongly defended the 'confusion' and said Trump was addressing a group of supporters from North Carolina whom he knew.

title: Extreme heat at Colorado airshow sickens 100, hospitalises 10
content: Extreme heat at the Pikes Peak Regional Airshow in Colorado Springs led to approximately 100 people needing emergency treatment, with 10 hospitalised on Saturday. Quick actions by organizers and emergency officials prevented more serious injuries. The event saw sold-out tickets, and attendees were reminded to stay hydrated amid the ongoing heat advisory issued by the National Weather Service.
summary: Extreme heat at the Pikes Peak Regional Airshow in Colorado Springs led to approximately 100 people needing emergency treatment, with 10 hospitalised on Saturday. Quick actions by organizers and emergency officials prevented more serious injuries. The event saw sold-out tickets, and attendees were reminded to stay hydrated amid the ongoing heat advisory issued by the National Weather Service.

title: Maureen Dowd gets hate for calling Biden to Kamala shift a coup
content: Columnist Maureen Dowd was slammed on social media for her opinion piece for NYT in which she called the Biden to Kamala Harris power shift a 'coup'. Titled "The Dems are Delighted. But a Coup is Still a Coup", Maureen wrote that as the Dems are all set for their convention in Chicago, there is a "wave of euphoria, exuberance, exultation" but everyone is made at one another.
summary: Columnist Maureen Dowd was slammed on social media for her opinion piece for NYT in which she called the Biden to Kamala Harris power shift a 'coup'. Titled "The Dems are Delighted. But a Coup is Still a Coup", Maureen wrote that as the Dems are all set for their convention in Chicago, there is a "wave of euphoria, exuberance, exultation" but everyone is made at one another.

title: Rep Anna Paulina Luna says 'Kamala is worst thing to happen...' amid swimsuit row
content: ​Florida Rep Anna Paulina Luna who has gone viral for her old swimsuit photo said Kamala Harris is the worst thing to happen to the country in a while. Appearing on the Fox News amid her controversy, Anna said she has done more as a member of the Congress than Kamala Harris.
summary: ​Florida Rep Anna Paulina Luna who has gone viral for her old swimsuit photo said Kamala Harris is the worst thing to happen to the country in a while. Appearing on the Fox News amid her controversy, Anna said she has done more as a member of the Congress than Kamala Harris.

title: 'Eating a bag of Doritos?': Elisabeth Hasselbeck gets schooled for slamming Kamala Harris
content: Vice president Kamala Harris said she ate a family-sized bag of nacho Doritos the night of the 2016 election. "I did not share one chip with anybody. Not even Doug. I just watched the TV with utter shock and dismay," Kamala Harris wrote in a fundraiser mail creating a fresh debate whether a world leader should binge-eat to sail through emotional crisis.
summary: Vice president Kamala Harris said she ate a family-sized bag of nacho Doritos the night of the 2016 election. "I did not share one chip with anybody. Not even Doug. I just watched the TV with utter shock and dismay," Kamala Harris wrote in a fundraiser mail creating a fresh debate whether a world leader should binge-eat to sail through emotional crisis.

title: Bangladesh deposed PM Sheikh Hasina sued in 2013 'mass murder' case
Thai king endorses Paetongtarn Shinawatra as prime minister
content: Paetongtarn, 37, becomes Thailand's youngest prime minister just days after ally Srettha Thavisin was dismissed as premier by the Constitutional Court, a judiciary central to Thailand's two decades of intermittent political turmoil.
summary: Paetongtarn, 37, becomes Thailand's youngest prime minister just days after ally Srettha Thavisin was dismissed as premier by the Constitutional Court, a judiciary central to Thailand's two decades of intermittent political turmoil.

title: Austria battles major flooding after record downpours
content: Torrents of muddy water swept cars through the ski resort of St. Anton in western Austria, footage posted on social media showed. Meanwhile record rainfall hit parts of Vienna in the east of the country, state broadcaster ORF said.
summary: Torrents of muddy water swept cars through the ski resort of St. Anton in western Austria, footage posted on social media showed. Meanwhile record rainfall hit parts of Vienna in the east of the country, state broadcaster ORF said.

title: 'They were men': Trump falsely labels female Olympic boxers, again
Russia launches third ballistic missile attack on Kyiv this month, Ukraine says
Hamas planned to exhume remains of British and Commonwealth soldiers from World War I and II buried in Gaza: IDF
content: Israeli Defence Forces discovered a 2022 plan by Hamas leaders to exhume British and Commonwealth soldiers’ remains from Gaza to prevent the UK from moving its embassy to Jerusalem. The plan included holding the remains hostage or demanding lease fees. Though the embassy move was cancelled, concerns persist that Hamas may use similar tactics in the future.
summary: Israeli Defence Forces discovered a 2022 plan by Hamas leaders to exhume British and Commonwealth soldiers’ remains from Gaza to prevent the UK from moving its embassy to Jerusalem. The plan included holding the remains hostage or demanding lease fees. Though the embassy move was cancelled, concerns persist that Hamas may use similar tactics in the future.

title: 'Still remember how excited she was...': Kamala shares childhood pic with mother
content: Kamala Harris revealed via social media that she worked at McDonald's as a teenager and during college to earn spending money. She reflected on her middle-class upbringing and her mother’s hard work to buy a home. Harris pledged to address economic struggles, reduce living costs, and provide mortgage assistance and tax credits for parents if elected President.
summary: Kamala Harris revealed via social media that she worked at McDonald's as a teenager and during college to earn spending money. She reflected on her middle-class upbringing and her mother’s hard work to buy a home. Harris pledged to address economic struggles, reduce living costs, and provide mortgage assistance and tax credits for parents if elected President.

title: 'Attempt to intimidate': FBI raids US home of analyst Dimitri Simes who advised Trump in 2016
content: The FBI conducted a raid on the Virginia home of Dimitri Simes, a former advisor to Donald Trump’s 2016 campaign. Simes, who was out of the country during the raid, expressed confusion and concern. His name appeared multiple times in the Mueller report on Russian interference. Simes has been active in Russia, recently moderating discussions with President Putin.
summary: The FBI conducted a raid on the Virginia home of Dimitri Simes, a former advisor to Donald Trump’s 2016 campaign. Simes, who was out of the country during the raid, expressed confusion and concern. His name appeared multiple times in the Mueller report on Russian interference. Simes has been active in Russia, recently moderating discussions with President Putin.

title: NYC mayor Eric Adams makes gaffe, confuses India with Pakistan at India Day Parade
content: Mayor Eric Adams of New York City made a significant error during his speech at an Indian Independence Day celebration in Queens. He mistakenly referred to India and its diaspora community as 'Pakistan' multiple times. Despite multiple reminders of the corrected name from the crowd, Adams continued to confuse the two nations in his remarks.
summary: Mayor Eric Adams of New York City made a significant error during his speech at an Indian Independence Day celebration in Queens. He mistakenly referred to India and its diaspora community as 'Pakistan' multiple times. Despite multiple reminders of the corrected name from the crowd, Adams continued to confuse the two nations in his remarks.

title: 'They turned him down because he’s Jewish': Trump on Josh Shapiro
content: Former President Donald Trump claimed at a rally in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania that Jews in the US face the most dangerous situation since the Holocaust. He cited a spike in antisemitic incidents and criticized Vice President Kamala Harris for allegedly not choosing Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro as her running mate due to his Jewish faith, a claim Shapiro denied.
summary: Former President Donald Trump claimed at a rally in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania that Jews in the US face the most dangerous situation since the Holocaust. He cited a spike in antisemitic incidents and criticized Vice President Kamala Harris for allegedly not choosing Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro as her running mate due to his Jewish faith, a claim Shapiro denied.

title: 'Saw Netflix series about their life ...': Columbia's vice president reveals real reason behind inviting Prince Harry and Meghan Markle
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's visit to Colombia was prompted by an invitation from Vice President Francia Márquez, who was inspired by their Netflix docuseries. The purpose of their visit was to promote mental health for young people and combat cyberbullying. Their series sheds light on their decision to step back from royal roles.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's visit to Colombia was prompted by an invitation from Vice President Francia Márquez, who was inspired by their Netflix docuseries. The purpose of their visit was to promote mental health for young people and combat cyberbullying. Their series sheds light on their decision to step back from royal roles.

title: Trump criticises Harris’ newly announced ‘Kamalanomics’
content: Former President Donald Trump, during a rally in Pennsylvania, criticised Vice President Kamala Harris's new economic plan, calling it 'full communist.' Trump argued that Harris's proposals for price controls on food and groceries would lead to negative outcomes like rationing and inflation, comparing them to failed policies in Venezuela and the Soviet Union.
summary: Former President Donald Trump, during a rally in Pennsylvania, criticised Vice President Kamala Harris's new economic plan, calling it 'full communist.' Trump argued that Harris's proposals for price controls on food and groceries would lead to negative outcomes like rationing and inflation, comparing them to failed policies in Venezuela and the Soviet Union.

title: UK government, for first time, plans to treat extreme misogyny as terrorism
content: The UK government introduced a new approach to counter-terrorism by addressing extreme misogyny. Home Secretary Yvette Cooper ordered a review to fill gaps in the current legislation and involve teachers, healthcare professionals, and local authorities in Prevent referrals. The initiative aims to combat the radicalisation of young men influenced by misogynistic figures. The new strategy is expected next year.
summary: The UK government introduced a new approach to counter-terrorism by addressing extreme misogyny. Home Secretary Yvette Cooper ordered a review to fill gaps in the current legislation and involve teachers, healthcare professionals, and local authorities in Prevent referrals. The initiative aims to combat the radicalisation of young men influenced by misogynistic figures. The new strategy is expected next year.

title: ‘Things I trust more than Trump’: Ana Navarro's list goes viral
content: Ana Navarro's Instagram post titled 'Things I Trust More Than Trump' went viral, featuring a humorous list of ten items. The list, including 'Flint, Michigan tap water' and 'gas station sushi,' sparked widespread engagement with over 50,000 likes. Followers and Navarro herself added more items to the list, driving further engagement and attention.
summary: Ana Navarro's Instagram post titled 'Things I Trust More Than Trump' went viral, featuring a humorous list of ten items. The list, including 'Flint, Michigan tap water' and 'gas station sushi,' sparked widespread engagement with over 50,000 likes. Followers and Navarro herself added more items to the list, driving further engagement and attention.

title: Nine Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf-affiliated MPs demand recusal of chief justice in election tribunals case
content: Nine PTI candidates demanded the recusal of CJP Qazi Faez Isa from hearing the case on Election Tribunals in Punjab. They claimed their lawyers faced difficulties in filing the application. The Supreme Court had suspended an earlier High Court judgement regarding tribunal formations. The case hearing is scheduled for August 19 with requests for adjournment due to lawyer availability issues.
summary: Nine PTI candidates demanded the recusal of CJP Qazi Faez Isa from hearing the case on Election Tribunals in Punjab. They claimed their lawyers faced difficulties in filing the application. The Supreme Court had suspended an earlier High Court judgement regarding tribunal formations. The case hearing is scheduled for August 19 with requests for adjournment due to lawyer availability issues.
